segments.script:
"Hey there, Appalatchians! Welcome home to Appalachia Radio. So, I heard a rumor that a group of settlers got attacked by some raiders out near Poseidon Energy Plant. Supposedly they were transporting some valuable junk to sell in Charleston. Word is, the raiders took off with all their loot and left 'em stranded.

Now, I don't know if this is true or just a tale to scare folks straight, but it's always good to be cautious out there, right? Especially when you're hauling around stuff that could make your life easier in these harsh times. Just remember, we're all neighbors here trying to rebuild and survive together.

That's the kind of spirit I want to hear more about on this show - our hopes for the future and how we can support each other along the way. So keep those stories coming in, and let's make Appalachia a place where everyone feels welcome and safe."

I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.

You know, I heard rumors going around about the Pioneer Scouts. Apparently, some folks have spotted them wandering near Vault 76 at night, like they're on a mission or something. Someone told me they even caught a glimpse of one wearing a little backpack! Now, I'm not saying this is true or anything, but it's definitely an interesting thought - our very own mini-scouts exploring the wasteland under the cover of darkness.

I mean, can you imagine if that was really happening? The next generation, venturing out into the unknown just like we did on Reclamation Day. It gives me hope for the future, even in these uncertain times. Here's some John Denver to match that optimistic vibe - "Country Roads" coming right up!

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia! I'm your DJ Julie here on Appalachia Radio.

You know, people love talking about rumors and stories in the wasteland. And, well, some of 'em might just be true! Like that time someone told me they saw a pack of ghouls doing karaoke at Abandoned Boutique, right? Now, I didn't actually see it myself, but word is they were belting out "Don't Fear the Reaper" like their lives depended on it.

Or how about this one: I heard there's a hidden stash of pre-war whiskey buried near an old mine in the Cranberry Glades. Apparently, some folks went looking for it and came back with a bad case of radiation poisoning...and a bottle or two of booze! So, if you're feeling brave and your taste buds are strong, you might want to give that a try.

Anyway, enough gossip for now. Let's get back to the music! Up next is one of my personal favorites - "Take Me Home, Country Roads" by John Denver. Enjoy!

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia.

I'm Julie, your DJ here on Radio Appalachia. Got some exciting news to share with you all today! The Brotherhood of Steel is setting up a new outpost in the old Abandoned Mine just outside of Harpers Ferry. Now, I know what you're thinking - "The Brotherhood? Aren't they those, um, militaristic types?" And yeah, that's true, but hear me out.

These are folks who've been working hard to protect us from those Raiders and Super Mutants. They've got some amazing tech and skills, and now they're expanding their efforts right here in our backyard! This outpost will help keep the roads between Harpers Ferry and the Cranberry Glades safe for traveling. Plus, it's another sign of people coming together and rebuilding.

So if you're ever in that area, be sure to give 'em a wave and maybe even stop by for a chat. They've got their work cut out for them, but with our support, I know they'll do great things! Thanks for listening, Appalachia - stay strong and keep on keeping on!
